summary: Vertebrates are animals with a backbone or spinal column, made of bones or cartilage. This group includes fish, amphibians, reptiles, birds, and mammals. There are over 69,000 known species of vertebrates. They come in various sizes, from the tiny Paedophryne amauensis frog to the massive blue whale. Vertebrates make up a small part of all animal species, with most being invertebrates. Hagfish, though not having a traditional backbone, are also considered vertebrates due to their close relation to lampreys.
title: Vertebrate
